hypothesis: The previously observed failure of Sharpness-Aware Minimization (SAM) in Experience Replay (Cycle 2) was primarily caused by the interaction between "Batch Normalization noise" and "New-Task Gradient Dominance"; combining SAM with a Group Normalization and Weight Standardization (GN+WS) backbone and a "Balanced-Gradient" perturbation—where the SAM perturbation $\epsilon$ is computed from the sum of the unit-normalized mean gradients of the current task and the replay buffer—will yield a 1.5% improvement in final average accuracy on SplitCIFAR-10 compared to the current best-performing baseline.
